article:
'Textile manufacturing' is a major industry. It is based in the conversion of
three types of fibre into yarn, then fabric, then textiles. These are then
fabricated into clothes or other artifacts. Cotton remains the most important
natural fibre, so is treated in depth. There are many variable processes
available at the spinning and fabric-forming stages coupled with the
complexities of the finishing and colouration processes to the production of a
wide ranges of products. There remains a large industry that uses hand
techniques to achieve the same results.
